alert.note: Alert for Simpson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 10:44AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Simpson County through 1115 AM CST... At 1042 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sanatorium and near Mendenhall, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Magee and Martinville around 1050 AM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for central Mississippi.
